Furthermore, a variety of mushrooms were assessed for antiviral activity against HSV-2 (strain BH) in RK-13 cells by Krupodorova et al.
47 The mushrooms were cultured as biomass and the mycelia were made into aqueous extracts using a 0.9% sodium chloride solution. Four species were found to inhibit HSV-2 replication, namely Fomes fomentarius (EC 50 = 0.62 mg/ml and SI = 40.32), Pleurotus ostreatus (EC 50 = 0.155 mg/ml and SI = 80.64), Auriporia aurea (EC 50 = 0.155 mg/ml and SI = 161.29), and Trametes versicolor (EC 50 = 0.077 mg/ml and SI = 324.67).
